paper_title: Enhanced selective photocatalytic CO 2 reduction into CO over Ag/CdS nanocomposites under visible light

catalyst.source: Herein, Ag-CdS nanocomposites were prepared by photodeposition method and examined for photocatalytic CO 2 reduction under visible light.
catalyst.context: Photocatalytic reduction of carbon dioxide can convert chemically inert carbon dioxide into useful chemical fuel in a mild manner.Herein, Ag-CdS nanocomposites were prepared by photodeposition method and examined for photocatalytic CO 2 reduction under visible light.Meanwhile, the nanocomposites were characterized by XRD, SEM, TEM, XPS, DRS and PL in detail.The results show that, the deposition of Ag improves the photocatalytic performance of CdS, especially in the selectivity of CO 2 -to-CO.The highest photocatalytic activity is achieved over 1.0 wt. Ag/CdS, with an increase by 3 times in comparison to CdS.In this reaction system, Ag can serve as electron trap as well as active site for CO 2 reduction, which is probably responsible for the enhanced activity and selectivity of CO 2 to CO over Ag/CdS.The possible mechanism of CO 2 photoreduction over Ag/CdS was proposed in view of the abovementioned analysis.

catalyst.source: Typically, to investigate the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction performance for the catalysts, CdS or Ag/CdS (5 mg), H 2 O (4 mL), and TEOA (2 mL) were added into a Schlenk flask reactor (80 mL).
catalyst.context: Cadmium sulfide (CdS) and silver nitrate (AgNO 3 ) were purchased form Aladdin Chemical Company, triethanolamine (TEOA) and N,N-Dimethylformamide (DMF) were provided by Sinopharm Chemical Reagent Co., Ltd.All the chemical reagents for the photocatalytic reactions were used without further purification.For the synthesis of Ag/CdS, CdS (20 mg) was dispersed in the mixture of H 2 O (16 mL) and TEOA (4 mL), a certain volume of 50 mmol/L AgNO 3 solution (the weight ratio of Ag to CdS for Ag/CdS is 0.5, 1.0, 3.0, or 5.0 wt.) was added into the mixture, then it was irradiated under visible light ( 420 nm) for one hour.The mixture was filtered and the solids were cleaned with D.I. water.Finally, the obtained Ag/CdS was dried in a vacuum oven at 60 C overnight.The value for the actual Ag loading of the synthesized catalysts obtained by using inductively coupled plasma mass spectrum (ICP-MS), which is summarized in Table 1. Powder X-ray diffraction (XRD) was collected on a Bruker D8 Advance instrument (Cu Ka1 irradiation, 1.5406A).Scanning electron microscope (SEM) images were taken on a field emission scanning electron microscope (Hitachi, SU8010).Transmission electron microscopy (TEM) images were obtained on a FEI Tencai 20 microscope.X-ray photoelectron spectra (XPS) were collected on a PHI Quantum 2000 XPS system with the C1s peak (284.6 eV) as a reference.UV-vis diffuse reflectance spectra (DRS) was measured on a Varian Cary 500 Scan, with BaSO 4 as a reference.Photoluminescence (PL) spectra were carried out on an Edinburgh FL/FS900 spectrophotometer at ambient condition.The Brunauer-Emmett-Teller (BET) specific surface area and CO 2 adsorption were measured with an ASAP2020M apparatus.After degassing in vacuum, the nitrogen adsorption and desorption isotherms for the samples were measured at 77 K, and CO 2 adsorption isotherms were measured at 273 K.The CO produced from 13 CO 2 isotopic experiment was carried out on an HP 5973 gas chromatographymass spectrometer (GC-MS). Typically, to investigate the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction performance for the catalysts, CdS or Ag/CdS (5 mg), H 2 O (4 mL), and TEOA (2 mL) were added into a Schlenk flask reactor (80 mL).Then pure CO 2 was introduced to the reactor with a partial pressure of 1.0 atm.A 300 W Xe lamp with a 420 nm cutoff filter was used as the light source.During the photocatalytic reaction, the reaction solution was vigorously stirred with a magnetic stirrer.After photocatalytic reaction for one hour, the formed products were sampled and quantified by the Shimadzu (GC-2014) gas chromatograph, equipped with a thermal conductivity detector (TCD), flame ionized detector (FID) and methanizer.

catalyst.source: Ag/CdS nanocomposites were successfully prepared by photodeposition of Ag tightly attached to CdS.
catalyst.context: Ag/CdS nanocomposites were successfully prepared by photodeposition of Ag tightly attached to CdS.The obtained Ag/CdS were effective as photocatalysts for the CO 2 reduction reaction, and 13 CO 2 isotope experiment confirmed that CO 2 was the carbon source to produce CO.The activity of CO 2 to CO over CdS is increased by up to 3 times when CdS is loaded with 1.0 wt. of Ag.This is because Ag can serve as electron trap as well as active site for CO 2 reduction.This work demonstrates a possibility for the use of silver as a cocatalyst in the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction under visible light. Fig. 1.X-ray diffraction patterns of CdS and Ag/CdS samples (CdS: PDF41-1049; Ag: PDF04-0783). Fig. 2. FESEM images of CdS (A) and 1.0 wt. Ag/CdS (B). Fig. 3. TEM images of 1.0 wt. Ag/CdS. Fig. 4. XPS survey spectrum of 1.0 wt. Ag/CdS (A), high-resolution spectra of Cd3d (B), S2p (C) and Ag3d (D). Fig. 5. N2 adsorption-desorption isotherms and corresponding pore size distribution curves (inset) of CdS and 1.0 wt. Ag/CdS. Fig. 8. Photocatalytic production of H2 and CO over Ag/CdS with the different amounts of Ag loading. Fig. 9.The effect of the volumetric ratio of H2O/TEOA on the phtocatalytic performance. Scheme 1. Proposed mechanism of the photocatalytic CO2 reduction over Ag/CdS. Fig. 11.Transient photocurrent response of CdS and 1.0 wt. Ag/CdS in 0.2 M Na2SO4 aqueous solution containing 5 TEOA under visible light irradiation. Fig. 12.The photoluminescence (PL) spectra of CdS and 1.0 wt. Ag/CdS. The loading amount of Ag in the catalysts. The SBET, pore size, pore volume, and the CO2 adsorbed amounts on CdS and 1.0 wt. Ag/CdS. APSUSC-33518; No. of Pages 8 The work was supported by 973 Program (2014CB260406), NSFC (21203030), Program for New Century Excellent Talents in University of Fujian Province (JA13020), Natural Science Foundation of Fujian Province (2014J01041) and the Award Program for Qishan Scholar of Fuzhou University (XQS1401). Supplementary data associated with this article can be found, in the online version, at http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.apsusc.2016.06.148.

co-catalyst.source: Cadmium sulfide (CdS) and silver nitrate (AgNO 3 ) were purchased form Aladdin Chemical Company, triethanolamine (TEOA) and N,N-Dimethylformamide (DMF) were provided by Sinopharm Chemical Reagent Co., Ltd.
co-catalyst.context: Cadmium sulfide (CdS) and silver nitrate (AgNO 3 ) were purchased form Aladdin Chemical Company, triethanolamine (TEOA) and N,N-Dimethylformamide (DMF) were provided by Sinopharm Chemical Reagent Co., Ltd.All the chemical reagents for the photocatalytic reactions were used without further purification.For the synthesis of Ag/CdS, CdS (20 mg) was dispersed in the mixture of H 2 O (16 mL) and TEOA (4 mL), a certain volume of 50 mmol/L AgNO 3 solution (the weight ratio of Ag to CdS for Ag/CdS is 0.5, 1.0, 3.0, or 5.0 wt.) was added into the mixture, then it was irradiated under visible light ( 420 nm) for one hour.The mixture was filtered and the solids were cleaned with D.I. water.Finally, the obtained Ag/CdS was dried in a vacuum oven at 60 C overnight.The value for the actual Ag loading of the synthesized catalysts obtained by using inductively coupled plasma mass spectrum (ICP-MS), which is summarized in Table 1. Powder X-ray diffraction (XRD) was collected on a Bruker D8 Advance instrument (Cu Ka1 irradiation, 1.5406A).Scanning electron microscope (SEM) images were taken on a field emission scanning electron microscope (Hitachi, SU8010).Transmission electron microscopy (TEM) images were obtained on a FEI Tencai 20 microscope.X-ray photoelectron spectra (XPS) were collected on a PHI Quantum 2000 XPS system with the C1s peak (284.6 eV) as a reference.UV-vis diffuse reflectance spectra (DRS) was measured on a Varian Cary 500 Scan, with BaSO 4 as a reference.Photoluminescence (PL) spectra were carried out on an Edinburgh FL/FS900 spectrophotometer at ambient condition.The Brunauer-Emmett-Teller (BET) specific surface area and CO 2 adsorption were measured with an ASAP2020M apparatus.After degassing in vacuum, the nitrogen adsorption and desorption isotherms for the samples were measured at 77 K, and CO 2 adsorption isotherms were measured at 273 K.The CO produced from 13 CO 2 isotopic experiment was carried out on an HP 5973 gas chromatographymass spectrometer (GC-MS). Typically, to investigate the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction performance for the catalysts, CdS or Ag/CdS (5 mg), H 2 O (4 mL), and TEOA (2 mL) were added into a Schlenk flask reactor (80 mL).Then pure CO 2 was introduced to the reactor with a partial pressure of 1.0 atm.A 300 W Xe lamp with a 420 nm cutoff filter was used as the light source.During the photocatalytic reaction, the reaction solution was vigorously stirred with a magnetic stirrer.After photocatalytic reaction for one hour, the formed products were sampled and quantified by the Shimadzu (GC-2014) gas chromatograph, equipped with a thermal conductivity detector (TCD), flame ionized detector (FID) and methanizer.

co-catalyst.source: This work demonstrates a possibility for the use of silver as a cocatalyst in the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction under visible light.
co-catalyst.context: Ag/CdS nanocomposites were successfully prepared by photodeposition of Ag tightly attached to CdS.The obtained Ag/CdS were effective as photocatalysts for the CO 2 reduction reaction, and 13 CO 2 isotope experiment confirmed that CO 2 was the carbon source to produce CO.The activity of CO 2 to CO over CdS is increased by up to 3 times when CdS is loaded with 1.0 wt. of Ag.This is because Ag can serve as electron trap as well as active site for CO 2 reduction.This work demonstrates a possibility for the use of silver as a cocatalyst in the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction under visible light. Fig. 1.X-ray diffraction patterns of CdS and Ag/CdS samples (CdS: PDF41-1049; Ag: PDF04-0783). Fig. 2. FESEM images of CdS (A) and 1.0 wt. Ag/CdS (B). Fig. 3. TEM images of 1.0 wt. Ag/CdS. Fig. 4. XPS survey spectrum of 1.0 wt. Ag/CdS (A), high-resolution spectra of Cd3d (B), S2p (C) and Ag3d (D). Fig. 5. N2 adsorption-desorption isotherms and corresponding pore size distribution curves (inset) of CdS and 1.0 wt. Ag/CdS. Fig. 8. Photocatalytic production of H2 and CO over Ag/CdS with the different amounts of Ag loading. Fig. 9.The effect of the volumetric ratio of H2O/TEOA on the phtocatalytic performance. Scheme 1. Proposed mechanism of the photocatalytic CO2 reduction over Ag/CdS. Fig. 11.Transient photocurrent response of CdS and 1.0 wt. Ag/CdS in 0.2 M Na2SO4 aqueous solution containing 5 TEOA under visible light irradiation. Fig. 12.The photoluminescence (PL) spectra of CdS and 1.0 wt. Ag/CdS. The loading amount of Ag in the catalysts. The SBET, pore size, pore volume, and the CO2 adsorbed amounts on CdS and 1.0 wt. Ag/CdS. APSUSC-33518; No. of Pages 8 The work was supported by 973 Program (2014CB260406), NSFC (21203030), Program for New Century Excellent Talents in University of Fujian Province (JA13020), Natural Science Foundation of Fujian Province (2014J01041) and the Award Program for Qishan Scholar of Fuzhou University (XQS1401). Supplementary data associated with this article can be found, in the online version, at http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.apsusc.2016.06.148.

light source.context: Photocatalytic reduction of carbon dioxide can convert chemically inert carbon dioxide into useful chemical fuel in a mild manner.Herein, Ag-CdS nanocomposites were prepared by photodeposition method and examined for photocatalytic CO 2 reduction under visible light.Meanwhile, the nanocomposites were characterized by XRD, SEM, TEM, XPS, DRS and PL in detail.The results show that, the deposition of Ag improves the photocatalytic performance of CdS, especially in the selectivity of CO 2 -to-CO.The highest photocatalytic activity is achieved over 1.0 wt. light source.source: For the synthesis of Ag/CdS, CdS (20 mg) was dispersed in the mixture of H 2 O (16 mL) and TEOA (4 mL), a certain volume of 50 mmol/L AgNO 3 solution (the weight ratio of Ag to CdS for Ag/CdS is 0.5, 1.0, 3.0, or 5.0 wt.) was added into the mixture, then it was irradiated under visible light ( 420 nm) for one hour.
light source.context: Cadmium sulfide (CdS) and silver nitrate (AgNO 3 ) were purchased form Aladdin Chemical Company, triethanolamine (TEOA) and N,N-Dimethylformamide (DMF) were provided by Sinopharm Chemical Reagent Co., Ltd.All the chemical reagents for the photocatalytic reactions were used without further purification.For the synthesis of Ag/CdS, CdS (20 mg) was dispersed in the mixture of H 2 O (16 mL) and TEOA (4 mL), a certain volume of 50 mmol/L AgNO 3 solution (the weight ratio of Ag to CdS for Ag/CdS is 0.5, 1.0, 3.0, or 5.0 wt.) was added into the mixture, then it was irradiated under visible light ( 420 nm) for one hour.The mixture was filtered and the solids were cleaned with D.I. water.Finally, the obtained Ag/CdS was dried in a vacuum oven at 60 C overnight.The value for the actual Ag loading of the synthesized catalysts obtained by using inductively coupled plasma mass spectrum (ICP-MS), which is summarized in Table 1. Powder X-ray diffraction (XRD) was collected on a Bruker D8 Advance instrument (Cu Ka1 irradiation, 1.5406A).Scanning electron microscope (SEM) images were taken on a field emission scanning electron microscope (Hitachi, SU8010).Transmission electron microscopy (TEM) images were obtained on a FEI Tencai 20 microscope.X-ray photoelectron spectra (XPS) were collected on a PHI Quantum 2000 XPS system with the C1s peak (284.6 eV) as a reference.UV-vis diffuse reflectance spectra (DRS) was measured on a Varian Cary 500 Scan, with BaSO 4 as a reference.Photoluminescence (PL) spectra were carried out on an Edinburgh FL/FS900 spectrophotometer at ambient condition.The Brunauer-Emmett-Teller (BET) specific surface area and CO 2 adsorption were measured with an ASAP2020M apparatus.After degassing in vacuum, the nitrogen adsorption and desorption isotherms for the samples were measured at 77 K, and CO 2 adsorption isotherms were measured at 273 K.The CO produced from 13 CO 2 isotopic experiment was carried out on an HP 5973 gas chromatographymass spectrometer (GC-MS). Typically, to investigate the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction performance for the catalysts, CdS or Ag/CdS (5 mg), H 2 O (4 mL), and TEOA (2 mL) were added into a Schlenk flask reactor (80 mL).Then pure CO 2 was introduced to the reactor with a partial pressure of 1.0 atm.A 300 W Xe lamp with a 420 nm cutoff filter was used as the light source.During the photocatalytic reaction, the reaction solution was vigorously stirred with a magnetic stirrer.After photocatalytic reaction for one hour, the formed products were sampled and quantified by the Shimadzu (GC-2014) gas chromatograph, equipped with a thermal conductivity detector (TCD), flame ionized detector (FID) and methanizer.

lamp.source: A 300 W Xe lamp with a 420 nm cutoff filter was used as the light source.
lamp.context: Cadmium sulfide (CdS) and silver nitrate (AgNO 3 ) were purchased form Aladdin Chemical Company, triethanolamine (TEOA) and N,N-Dimethylformamide (DMF) were provided by Sinopharm Chemical Reagent Co., Ltd.All the chemical reagents for the photocatalytic reactions were used without further purification.For the synthesis of Ag/CdS, CdS (20 mg) was dispersed in the mixture of H 2 O (16 mL) and TEOA (4 mL), a certain volume of 50 mmol/L AgNO 3 solution (the weight ratio of Ag to CdS for Ag/CdS is 0.5, 1.0, 3.0, or 5.0 wt.) was added into the mixture, then it was irradiated under visible light ( 420 nm) for one hour.The mixture was filtered and the solids were cleaned with D.I. water.Finally, the obtained Ag/CdS was dried in a vacuum oven at 60 C overnight.The value for the actual Ag loading of the synthesized catalysts obtained by using inductively coupled plasma mass spectrum (ICP-MS), which is summarized in Table 1. Powder X-ray diffraction (XRD) was collected on a Bruker D8 Advance instrument (Cu Ka1 irradiation, 1.5406A).Scanning electron microscope (SEM) images were taken on a field emission scanning electron microscope (Hitachi, SU8010).Transmission electron microscopy (TEM) images were obtained on a FEI Tencai 20 microscope.X-ray photoelectron spectra (XPS) were collected on a PHI Quantum 2000 XPS system with the C1s peak (284.6 eV) as a reference.UV-vis diffuse reflectance spectra (DRS) was measured on a Varian Cary 500 Scan, with BaSO 4 as a reference.Photoluminescence (PL) spectra were carried out on an Edinburgh FL/FS900 spectrophotometer at ambient condition.The Brunauer-Emmett-Teller (BET) specific surface area and CO 2 adsorption were measured with an ASAP2020M apparatus.After degassing in vacuum, the nitrogen adsorption and desorption isotherms for the samples were measured at 77 K, and CO 2 adsorption isotherms were measured at 273 K.The CO produced from 13 CO 2 isotopic experiment was carried out on an HP 5973 gas chromatographymass spectrometer (GC-MS). Typically, to investigate the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction performance for the catalysts, CdS or Ag/CdS (5 mg), H 2 O (4 mL), and TEOA (2 mL) were added into a Schlenk flask reactor (80 mL).Then pure CO 2 was introduced to the reactor with a partial pressure of 1.0 atm.A 300 W Xe lamp with a 420 nm cutoff filter was used as the light source.During the photocatalytic reaction, the reaction solution was vigorously stirred with a magnetic stirrer.After photocatalytic reaction for one hour, the formed products were sampled and quantified by the Shimadzu (GC-2014) gas chromatograph, equipped with a thermal conductivity detector (TCD), flame ionized detector (FID) and methanizer.
